description: Chisenhale Art Place is a multi-disciplinary arts building occupying a former factory in Tower Hamlets, consisting of 40 artist studios, a renowned art gallery and an artist-led dance space. On Sunday 15th September, the building will open its doors to offer a view of its studios and gallery, alongside hosting a performance by dancer/choreographer Otis Cameron Carr and partner Jack Thomson.

events.name: Drop in: Performance and Open Doors
events.notes: Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email about any changes to the programme that might affect your visit.

factsheet.heading: Chisenhale Art Place
paragraphs: Chisenhale Art Place is home to three distinct initiatives – Chisenhale Dance Space, Chisenhale Gallery and Chisenhale Studios – with each operating unique programmes that enable emerging and established artists and dancers to develop, experiment and make exceptional work.

travel_info: Additional travel info: Chisenhale Art Place is located halfway between Bethnal Green and Mile End Underground stations.

name: Chisenhale Art Place
